sen.j: 喬子女王（たかこじょおう、寛政7年6月14日 (旧暦)（1795年7月29日） - 天保11年1月16日 (旧暦)（1840年2月18日））は、江戸幕府第12代征夷大将軍・徳川家慶の正室（御台所）。
sen.e: Princess Takako (July 29, 1795 - February 18, 1840. She was the legal wife of Ieyoshi TOKUGAWA, the 12th seiitaishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians) of the the Edo feudal government.

The Princess Takako (July 29, 1795 - February 18, 1840) was the legal wife (Midaidokoro) of Ieyoshi TOKUGAWA, the 12th seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: the を補いました。(Midaidokoro)を補いました。カッコを修正しました。スペースを修正しました。「征夷大将軍」、「江戸幕府」を修正しました。
sen.e: The Princess Takako (July 29, 1795 - February 18, 1840) was the legal wife (Midaidokoro) of Ieyoshi TOKUGAWA, the 12th seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 幼称は楽宮（さざのみや）、院号は浄観院（じょうかんいん）。
sen.e: Her childhood name was 'Sazanomiya', and honorific Buddhist title was Jokanin.
sen.cmt: 院号はコトバンクによると「 皇太后・准母など皇族の女性で、上皇に準じた待遇を受ける人への尊称。「建礼門院」「東三条院」など。」とのことでした。また、オックスフォード辞書によれば女性に対する尊敬の念を込めた呼び方という事なので、'honorific title'は院号の訳しました。http://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/honorific?view=uk
sen.e: Her childhood name was Sazanomiya, and the honorific Buddhist title was Jokanin.
sen.cmt: クォーツを削除しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: Her childhood name was Sazanomiya, and the honorific Buddhist title was Jokanin.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Brief Personal History
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 有栖川宮織仁親王の第6皇女。
sen.e: She was 6th daughter of Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Orihito
sen.cmt: Princessよりdaughterとした方が英語として自然です。
sen.e: She was the sixth princess of Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Orihito.
sen.cmt: the, ピリオドを補いました。6th daughter→sixth princess と修正しました。
sen.e: She was the sixth princess of Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Orihito.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 母は側室の高木敦子（通称・常盤木、織仁親王の薨後は落飾して常信院）。
sen.e: Her mother was a concubine, Atsuko TAKAGI. She was commonly called Tokiwagi, but later called Joshin-in after the death of Imperial Prince Orihito.
sen.cmt: 常信院
sen.e: Her mother was a concubine, Atsuko TAKAGI (commonly called Tokiwagi, but later called Joshinin entering nunhood after the death of the Imperial Prince Orihito).
sen.cmt: カッコを補い、修正しました。
sen.e: Her mother was a concubine, Atsuko TAKAGI (commonly called Tokiwagi, but later called Joshinin entering nunhood after the death of the Imperial Prince Orihito).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 兄に有栖川宮韶仁親王・三千院承眞法親王・輪王寺舜仁入道親王・知恩院尊超入道親王など、妹に吉子女王（貞芳院、水戸藩主・徳川斉昭正室）などがいる。
sen.e: Takako had Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Tsunahito as a brother, and Princess Yoshiko as a sister who became the legal wife of Nariaki TOKUGAWA, the lord of the Mito Domain (Yoshiko's Buddhist title was Teiho-in).
sen.cmt: 承眞, 舜仁の定訳と読み方が不明です。
sen.e: Takako had Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Tsunahito, the Cloistered Imperial Prince 承眞 of Sanzen-in Temple, the priestly Imperial Prince 舜仁 of Rinno-ji Temple and priestly Imperial Prince Soncho of Chion-in Temple as the older brothers, and the Princess Yoshiko (Teihoin, the legal wife of Nariaki TOKUGAWA, the lord of the Mito Domain) as the younger sister.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。a→the,スペースを修正しました。brother→older brother,sister→younger sister と修正しました。訳抜けしていた「三千院承眞法親王・輪王寺舜仁入道親王・知恩院尊超入道親王」をそれぞれ訳出しました。ただし、「承眞」「舜仁」の読みは確認できておりません。
sen.e: Takako had Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Tsunahito, the Cloistered Imperial Prince 承眞 of Sanzen-in Temple, the priestly Imperial Prince 舜仁 of Rinno-ji Temple and priestly Imperial Prince Soncho of Chion-in Temple as the older brothers, and the Princess Yoshiko (Teihoin, the legal wife of Nariaki TOKUGAWA, the lord of the Mito Domain) as the younger sister.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 享和3年9月3日（1803年10月18日）に家慶と婚約が治定、翌文化 (元号)元年9月3日（1804年10月6日）、幕府の希望により喬子女王まだ数えで10歳にして江戸へ下向、以後婚儀までの5年間を江戸城西ノ丸にて過ごす。
sen.e: Takako was engaged to Ieyoshi Tokugawa on October 18, 1803. On October 6, 1804, when she was only 9 years old, she left the capital Kyoto to move to Tokyo and lived in the Nishinomaru compound at Edo-jo Castle until her wedding 5 years later.
sen.cmt: 数え10歳なので満9歳だと理解して訳しました。
sen.e: Takako was engaged to Ieyoshi on October 18, 1803, then on October 6, 1804, when she was only nine years old, she left the capital Kyoto to move to Edo as the favor of the bakufu, and lived in the Nishinomaru compound of Edo-jo Castle until the wedding five years later.
sen.cmt: Tokugawa を削除しました。パンクチュエーション、スペースを修正しました。9→nine,Tokyo→Edo,5→five,her→the と修正しました。as the favor of the bakufu を補いました。
sen.e: Takako was engaged to Ieyoshi on October 18, 1803, then on October 6, 1804, when she was only nine years old, she left the capital Kyoto to move to Edo as the favor of the bakufu, and lived in the Nishinomaru compound of Edo-jo Castle until the wedding five years later.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文化6年12月1日（1810年1月6日）、正式に家慶と婚姻。
sen.e: On January 6, 1810, Takako married to Ieyoshi.
On January 6, 1810, Takako officially married Ieyoshi.
sen.cmt: officially を補いました。married to→married と修正しました。
sen.e: On January 6, 1810, Takako officially married Ieyoshi.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文化10年10月30日（1813年11月22日）に長男・竹千代、文化12年2月7日（1815年3月17日）に次女・儔姫、文化13年10月23日（1816年12月11日）に三女・最玄院を生むも、いずれも早世。
sen.e: She gave birth to the first son, Takechiyo on November 22, 1813, the second daughter, Lady Tomo-hime on March 17, 1815, and the third daughter, Saigen-in on December 11, 1816, but, all of them died very young.
sen.cmt: 最玄院の読み方を調べましたが確認不可能でした。
sen.e: She gave birth to the first son, Takechiyo on November 22, 1813, the second daughter, Tomohime on March 17, 1815, and the third daughter, Saigen-in on December 11, 1816, but, all of them died very young.
sen.cmt: Lady Tomo-hime→Tomohime,スペースを修正しました。「最玄院」の読みは確認できておりません。
sen.e: She gave birth to the first son, Takechiyo on November 22, 1813, the second daughter, Tomohime on March 17, 1815, and the third daughter, Saigen-in on December 11, 1816, but, all of them died very young.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文政5年3月1日（1822年4月22日）に従三位に叙せられる。
sen.e: On 22 April, 1822, Takako was awarded Jusanmi, junior third rank.
On April 22, 1822, Takako was conferred Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: 22 April→April 22,awarded→conferred,「従三位」を修正しました。
sen.e: On April 22, 1822, Takako was conferred Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天保8年4月2日（1837年5月6日）、家慶の将軍襲職によって本丸大奥に移るに当たり、御台所と称した。
sen.e: As Ieyoshi TOKUGAWA assumed the power as the Shogun on May 6, 1837, so did Takako. She moved into O-oku, the inner palace of the keep, and was addressed 'Midaidokoro' that was an honorific title of Shogun's legal wife.
As Ieyoshi succeeded to become the Shogun on May 6, 1837, she moved into O-oku, the inner palace of the keep, and was addressed to Midaidokoro, the honorific title of shogun's legal wife.
sen.cmt: TOKUGAWA を削除しました。 assumed the power as→succeeded to become,パンクチュエーションを修正しました。addressed→addressed to,クォーツを削除しました。スペースの修正、that was an→the,Shogun's→shogun's と修正しました。
sen.e: As Ieyoshi succeeded to become the Shogun on May 6, 1837, she moved into O-oku, the inner palace of the keep, and was addressed to Midaidokoro, the honorific title of shogun's legal wife.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: Takako died at 46 on February 18, 1840.
sen.cmt: 旧暦から西暦への変換はhttp://maechan.net/kanreki/のサイトを使いました。
sen.e: Takako died at the age of 46 on February 18, 1840.
sen.cmt: the age of を補いました。
sen.e: Takako died at the age of 46 on February 18, 1840.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 公には1月24日死去と発表された。
sen.e: However, it was officially announced that she died on February 26, 1840.
sen.cmt: 旧暦から西暦への変換はhttp://maechan.net/kanreki/のサイトを使いました。
sen.e: However, it was officially announced that she died on February 26, 1840.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: However, it was officially announced that she died on February 26, 1840.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 戒名は浄観院殿慈門妙信大姉。
sen.e: Her posthumous Buddhist name was Jokan-inden Jimonmyoushin Daishi
sen.cmt: 戒名の読み方が不明です。
sen.e: Her posthumous Buddhist name was Jokan-inden Jimonmyoushin Daishi.
sen.cmt: was→is と修正しました。ピリオドを補いました。「浄観院殿慈門妙信大姉」の読みは確認できておりません。
sen.e: Her posthumous Buddhist name was 浄観院殿慈門妙信大姉.
sen.cmt: 浄観院殿慈門妙信大姉の読みが不明のため漢字のままとしました。

sen.j: 寛永寺に葬られたほか、故郷である京都の一心院に遺髪塔が建てられた。
sen.e: Takako was buried at Kanei-ji Temple, and a monument containing her hair was built at Isshin-in Temple in her native Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 遺髪塔の定訳が見つからなかったので "a monument containing her hair "としました。
sen.e: Takako was buried at Kanei-ji Temple, and a monument containing her hair was built at Isshin-in Temple in her native Kyoto.
sen.cmt: Kyoto City→Kyoto と修正しました。「遺髪塔」の定訳は確認が取れておりません。
sen.e: Takako was buried at Kanei-ji Temple, and a monument containing her hair was built at Isshin-in Temple in her native Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同年2月27日（1840年3月30日）に従二位、弘化2年6月3日（1845年7月7日）に従一位が追贈された。
sen.e: Takako was awarded Junii (Junior Second Rank) On March 30, 1840, and Juichii (Junior First Rank) on July 7, 1845.
Takako was posthumously conferred Junii (Junior Second Rank) On March 30, 1840, and Juichii (Junior First Rank) on July 7, 1845.
sen.cmt: awarded→posthumously conferred,スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: Takako was posthumously conferred Junii (Junior Second Rank) On March 30, 1840, and Juichii (Junior First Rank) on July 7, 1845.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 2008年6月9日、谷中霊園内にある寛永寺徳川家霊廟改葬のため、坂詰秀一・近世墓所調査団名誉団長らによる発掘調査を実施した。
sen.e: On June 9, 2008, an early-modern graveyard research group led by Hideichi SAKAZUME excavated the mausoleum of the Tokugawa family in preparation for its renovation work in the precinct of Kanei-ji Temple at the Yanaka graveyard.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: On June 9, 2008, the early-modern graveyard research group led by Hideichi SAKAZUME excavated the mausoleum of the Tokugawa family of Kanei-ji Temple in the precinct of the Yanaka graveyard, for its renovation work.
sen.cmt: an→the,スペースを修正しました。the を補いました。文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: On June 9, 2008, the early-modern graveyard research group led by Hideichi SAKAZUME excavated the mausoleum of the Tokugawa family of Kanei-ji Temple in the precinct of the Yanaka graveyard, for its renovation work.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 15行、189文字が刻まれた国内最大の墓誌（縦横2.9メートル、厚さ28センチ、重量5.3トン）や、木製フレームの眼鏡などの副葬品が出土したと発表。
sen.e: They found an epitaph in size of 2.9mx2.9mx28cm, weighing 5.3tons, which had text engravings of 18 lines with 189 characters. They also found other burial goods such as a pair of wooden framed spectacles.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: They announced that they found the domestically largest epitaph (2.9 m in length and width, 28 cm thickness, 5.3 tons), which had the engravings of 15 lines with 189 letters, and they also found other burial goods such as a pair of wooden framed spectacles.
sen.cmt: カッコを補い、文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: They announced that they found the domestically largest epitaph (2.9 m in length and width, 28 cm thickness, 5.3 tons), which had the engravings of 15 lines with 189 letters, and they also found other burial goods such as a pair of wooden framed spectacles.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 妹の吉子女王が徳川斉昭に嫁ぐ際、口添えをしたともいわれる。
sen.e: Some say Takako advised her sister Princess Yoshiko to marry Nariaki TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: http://spysee.jp/吉子女王/100677/によると吉子女王と 徳川斉昭との婚約は、喬子女王の肝いりでなされたとのことですので口添えをadvicseと訳しました。
sen.e: Some say that Takako advised her younger sister, the Princess Yoshiko to marry Nariaki TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: that, the, younger, カンマを補いました。
sen.e: Some say that Takako advised her younger sister, the Princess Yoshiko to marry Nariaki TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
